msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l: And Sarai, Abram’s wife, bore him no children. And shehad an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.
And Sarai saidto Abram, ‘Lo, now, the Lord has restrained me from bearing:Come to my maidservant. Maybe I will be childed through her.’And Abram listened to the words of Sarai.
AndSarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her own maidservant the Egyptian,after Abram had dwelt ten years in the landof Canaan, and gave her to her own husband Abramto be his wife.
And he came to Hagar, and she conceived.And she saw that she had conceived, and her mistress was despisedin her eyes.
And Sarai said to Abram,‘My wrong is on you! I gave my maidservant to your bosom,and she saw that she had conceived, and I became despisedin her eyes. May the Lord judge between you and me!’
But Abram said to Sarai, ‘Lo, your maidservantis in your hand. Do to her as it would seem good in your eyes.’And Sarai mistreated her, and she fled from before her.
And the angel of the Lord found her by a spring of waterin the wilderness, by the spring on the way to Shur.
And he said, ‘Oh Hagar, Sarai’s maidservant,where have you come from and where are you going?’ And Hagar said,‘I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.’

Andthe angel of the Lord said to her, ‘Return to your mistress, and suffer under her hands.’And the angel of the Lord said to her,‘I will surely multiply your offspring, and it will not be countable because of its multitude.’
And the angel of the Lord said to her, ‘Lo, youare pregnant, and you will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael,because the Lord has heard your affliction.
And he will be a wildman, his hand against everyone and everyone’s hand against him, andhe will dwell over against all his brethren.’
And she called the name of the angelof the Lord that spoke to her, ‘You God, see me’, for she said,‘Now, I have even seen the angel, after I had been seenin the house of Abram.’
Therefore thewell was called, by him who called it, Beer-Lahai-Roi. Lo, it is betweenKadesh and Bered.
And Hagar boreAbram a son: and Abram called his son’s name Ishmael,whom Hagar bore.
And Abram was eighty-sixyears old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
